title: Efficacy and Safety of Erenumab in Migraine Prevention: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
authors: Dodick DW, Ashina M, Brandes JL, et al.
abstract: Erenumab, a monoclonal antibody targeting the calcitonin gene-related peptide receptor, significantly reduces monthly migraine days in patients with episodic and chronic migraine.

title: Tension-Type Headache: Pathophysiology and Treatment
authors: Bendtsen L, Evers S, Linde M, et al.
abstract: Tension-type headache is the most common primary headache disorder, affecting up to 80% of the population.
key_findings: First-line treatment includes NSAIDs and acetaminophen
Preventive treatment with amitriptyline for chronic cases

title: Dapagliflozin in Patients with Heart Failure and Reduced Ejection Fraction
authors: McMurray JJV, Solomon SD, Inzucchi SE, et al.
journal: The New England Journal of Medicine
abstract: In patients with heart failure and a reduced ejection fraction, the risk of worsening heart failure or death from cardiovascular causes was lower among those who received dapagliflozin.
key_findings: 26% reduction in cardiovascular death or heart failure hospitalization

title: Efficacy and Safety of mRNA-1273 SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine in Adults Aged 65 Years and Older
authors: Baden LR, El Sahly HM, Essink B, et al.
journal: The New England Journal of Medicine
abstract: The mRNA-1273 vaccine showed 94.1% efficacy against COVID-19, including severe disease.
key_findings: 100% efficacy against severe COVID-19 in elderly

title: Medication Overuse Headache: Clinical Features, Pathophysiology, and Management
authors: Diener HC, Dodick D, Evers S, et al.
abstract: Medication overuse headache (MOH) is a secondary headache disorder caused by overuse of acute headache medications.
key_findings: Most common with triptans and combination analgesics
Withdrawal therapy is the treatment of choice

title: Cluster Headache: Clinical Features, Pathophysiology, and Treatment Options
authors: Goadsby PJ, Lipton RB, Ferrari MD
journal: The New England Journal of Medicine
abstract: Cluster headache is a severe primary headache disorder characterized by recurrent, unilateral, orbital or temporal pain attacks.
key_findings: Severe unilateral headache attacks lasting 15-180 minutes
High-flow oxygen and triptans are first-line acute treatments
